entry.title: Submissions open for Godot 2024 showreel!
entry.content: Showcase your Godot creations in 2024! We're inviting submissions of short videos featuring your published or in-progress Godot games or tools. Don't miss this chance to be a part of it!

entry.title: About Official Console Ports
entry.content: With this post we aim to address the community’s questions about the lack of official console ports through the Godot Foundation.

entry.title: Meeting the community at gamescom 2024
entry.content: Back from gamescom, ready to report.

entry.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.4 dev 1
entry.content: The first snapshot after releasing 4.3, already packed with new features!

entry.title: Godot 4.3, a shared effort
entry.content: With over 3,500 commits authored by over 500 contributors, the latest Godot Engine release comes packed full of new features and improvements.

entry.title: Design of the Skeleton Modifier 3D
entry.content: We have reworked the skeleton bone update process to add SkeletonModifier3D for modifying the Skeleton.

entry.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.3 RC 3
entry.content: With all known major regressions fixed, we are now publishing a third release candidate to confirm that 4.3 is ready to go stable.

entry.title: Gamescom here we come!
entry.content: We are once again attending gamescom, and organizing two meet-up opportunities this time.

entry.title: Introducing the improved ufbx importer in Godot 4.3
entry.content: Godot 4.3 now includes native .fbx support

entry.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.3 RC 2
entry.content: After a week in the Release Candidate stage, we have squashed most bugs we were still tracking for 4.3, and are ready for a second candidate.

entry.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.3 RC 1
entry.content: We are cautiously optimistic that Godot 4.3 is ready for release, please test it and let us know if we are right!

entry.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.3 beta 3
entry.content: We are nearing the end of the beta phase for Godot 4.3, which is shaping up to be a very solid release, solving a lot of pain points.

entry.title: New Dev Fund Perks: Discord Role and Forum Badge
entry.content: Proudly display your support on our community platforms.

entry.title: Release candidate: Godot 3.6 RC 1
entry.content: We are now at the Release Candidate stage, finalizing everything so that we can release 3.6-stable for all users.

entry.title: Godot Community Poll 2024
entry.content: We want to learn more about the Godot community, understand who the users of the engine are, and find out how we can better support you.

entry.title: Godot returns: gamescom latam
entry.content: Godot will be present at gamescom latam once again: meet contributors and fellow gamedevs at the booth, or sign up to our very own party!

entry.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.3 beta 2
entry.content: Godot 4.3 is in beta, and progressing well towards stable. This beta 2 fixes many critical issues reported by testers of the previous snapshots.

entry.title: GodotCon 24 - Submit ideas! Get tickets!
entry.content: GodotCon 24 will take place on the 12+13th of October in Berlin, Germany. The first batch of tickets as well as the call for speakers and exhibitors just went live. Sponsors welcome.

entry.title: Migrating Animations from Godot 4.0 to 4.3
entry.content: In Godot 4.3, a large number of animation features have been reworked since 4.0, so it's time to migrate your animations.

entry.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.3 beta 1
entry.content: Godot 4.3 is ready for broad testing as we finalize the release.

entry.title: Web Export in 4.3
entry.content: With single-threaded builds and sample playback, it's now easier than ever to export your game to the Web with Godot 4.3. And more!

entry.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 3.6 beta 5
entry.content: This beta represents feature freeze for 3.6. We will now concentrate on bug fixing until we reach stable.

entry.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.3 dev 6
entry.content: The last dev snapshot for 4.3 before feature freeze is a big one after 6 weeks of work!

entry.title: Introducing Reverse Z (AKA I'm sorry for breaking your shader)
entry.content: We are breaking compatibility for some custom shaders. Here is why.
